recipes.name: Paneer Tikka
ingredients: 1/2 cup Greek Yogurt (or regular yogurt, drained)
1 small Green Bell Pepper (Capsicum), cut into 1-inch pieces
1 small Red Onion, cut into 1-inch pieces
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the minced garlic, grated ginger, lemon juice, yogurt, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red pepper powder, black pepper, and salt.
Step 2: Cut the paneer, bell pepper, and red onion into 1-inch pieces. Add the paneer and vegetables to the marinade and gently mix to coat evenly. Let it marinate for 20-30 minutes.
Step 3: Thread the marinated paneer and vegetables onto skewers, alternating between the ingredients.  If desired, add a few grape tomatoes to the skewers as well.
Step 4: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Grill the skewers for 4-5 minutes per side, or until the vegetables are tender and the paneer is lightly charred.
Step 5: Remove the skewers from the grill and serve hot. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the paneer tikka before serving, if desired.

Use selective focus on the charred edges and tender interior, with a shallow depth of field blurring the garnished cilantro and lemon wedges in the foreground and background. Employ moody, directional lighting to highlight the texture and rich orange-red hue. Incorporate textured linens and rustic servingware.  Compose the image from a slightly overhead angle to showcase the skewers and accompanying elements.

recipes.name: Paneer Tikka Pulao
ingredients: Leftover marinade from paneer tikka preparation (see notes)
directions: Step 1: Marinate and grill the paneer: Marinate paneer cubes for at least 3-4 hours. Grill the paneer cubes in a pan or oven until lightly browned on all sides. Set aside.
Step 2: Sauté aromatics: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add bay leaves, whole red chilies, cumin seeds, green cardamom, and black cardamom. Sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.

Step 3: Add leftover marinade and spices: Pour the leftover marinade from the paneer tikka into the pan. Add ground cinnamon and stir constantly until the marinade thickens and separates slightly.  This will add a unique tangy flavor to the pulao.
Step 4: Add vegetables: Add diced onions and bell pepper to the pan. Stir to combine. Cover and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly softened but still retain some crunch.

Step 5: Combine rice and paneer: Add the cooked starch-free rice to the pan. If desired, add crushed red pepper flakes for extra heat. Gently toss to combine the rice with the vegetables and spices. Add the grilled paneer tikka cubes and gently fold them into the rice.
Step 6: Adjust seasonings and serve: Adjust salt to taste. Serve the paneer tikka pulao hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.  This dish pairs well with pickle or green chutney.

recipes.name: Lychee Paneer Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 (20 ounce) can lychees in light syrup
2 cups tomato sauce (marinara sauce or 4 large pureed ripe tomatoes)
1/2 teaspoon garam masala (or 1 clove, 1/2 inch cinnamon stick, and 1 cardamom pod, ground)
1/2 pound paneer (or firm tofu or grilled chicken)
1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste (3 cloves garlic and 1-inch piece ginger, finely minced)
1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil or cilantro
directions: Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a pan. Once melted, add the garam masala and cook until fragrant (30-40 seconds).
Step 2: Add the sliced onion and ginger-garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onions soften slightly, being careful not to burn the garlic.
Step 3: Add the tomato sauce, 1/2 cup water, salt, red pepper powder, and 2 tablespoons of honey to the pan. Mix well and bring to a boil over high heat.
Step 4: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10-12 minutes, or until the sauce deepens in color.
Step 5: While the sauce simmers, heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a separate pan.
Step 6: Slice the paneer (or tofu) into small, rectangular pieces. Remove excess moisture before frying to prevent oil splattering.
Step 7: Add the paneer/tofu to the hot pan and fry until lightly caramelized on 2-3 sides (about 4-5 minutes for paneer, longer for tofu).
Step 8: Add the lychees and 1/4 cup of lychee syrup to the simmering sauce. Taste and adjust salt if needed.
Step 9: Add the fried paneer/tofu and heavy cream to the sauce. Continue cooking for two minutes, then remove from heat.
Step 10: Garnish with fresh basil or cilantro.
Step 11: Serve hot with steamed rice or naan bread.

Incorporate dark wood background, brass serving spoon, and scattered cilantro for garnish. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle, showcasing the dish's depth and inviting texture. Aim for a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Popcorn
ingredients: 1/2 cup rolled oats or quick-cooking oats, coarsely crushed
directions: Step 1: Coarsely crush the rolled oats in a grinder or food processor. Do not grind to a fine powder. Set aside.
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, gently combine the paneer cubes, 1/2 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder, parsley, oregano, black pepper, and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Ensure the paneer cubes do not break.

Step 3: In another bowl, whisk together the besan, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, remaining 1/2 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add water until a thick batter forms, ensuring no lumps.
Step 4: Dip each paneer cube into the batter, coating it evenly. Allow excess batter to drip off.
Step 5: Roll the coated paneer cube in the crushed oats, ensuring it's fully covered.
Step 6: Repeat steps 4 and 5 for all paneer cubes.
Step 7: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pan over medium heat. Test the oil by dropping a small amount of batter into it; if it rises steadily, the oil is ready.
Step 8: Carefully add the crumb-coated paneer cubes to the hot oil in batches, avoiding overcrowding.
Step 9: Fry the paneer cubes until golden brown and crispy, turning occasionally. This should take approximately 3-4 minutes per batch.
Step 10: Remove the fried paneer popcorn with a slotted spoon and place it on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil.
Step 11: Serve the paneer popcorn hot with your favorite dipping sauce or chutney.

recipes.name: Tandoori Paneer Tikka Kebabs
ingredients: 1 large onion, cut into 1-inch square pieces
1 red bell pepper, deseeded and cut into 2-inch cubes
1 green bell pepper, deseeded and cut into 2-inch cubes
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine 2 1/2 tablespoons of Tandoori masala, yogurt, 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, and salt. Mix into a smooth paste.
Step 2: Add the paneer cubes to the bowl and gently mix to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Step 3: In a separate bowl, mix the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of Tandoori masala with the onion pieces, ensuring they are well coated.
Step 4: Thread the marinated paneer, onion, and red and green bell pepper pieces onto bamboo skewers.
Step 5: Preheat the grill to medium heat.
Step 6: Place the paneer skewers on the hot grill and brush with a little vegetable oil (about 1 tablespoon per side).
Step 7: Grill for 4-5 minutes per side, or until the paneer is light golden brown and the onions are soft. Be careful not to overcook, as the paneer can become rubbery.
Step 8: Remove the skewers from the grill and place them on a serving plate.
Step 9: Sprinkle with chaat masala.
Step 10: Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the skewers, garnish with lemon wedges, and serve hot.

Soft, directional lighting from the side highlights the spice blend's rich color and creates a warm, inviting mood. Garnish with fresh cilantro and a sprinkle of extra tandoori masala. recipes.name: Paneer Pulao (Indian Rice Pilaf with Paneer)
ingredients: 1 black cardamom pod (seeds removed and husks discarded, optional)
2 to 3 green cardamom pods (whole or seeds removed)
1 small piece stone flower (rock flower, pathar phool, or kalpasi, optional)
1 1/2 cups basmati rice or pulao rice
250 to 300 grams paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed
1 medium to large onion, thinly sliced
2 tablespoons ghee or oil (for the pulao)
2 to 3 teaspoons ghee or oil (for pan-frying paneer)
1 1/2 to 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint leaves
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Pulao Masala: In a small dry grinder or coffee grinder, combine the cumin seeds, caraway seeds (if using), fennel seeds (if using), black cardamom seeds (if using), green cardamom seeds (if removing from pods), cloves, cinnamon, mace, and stone flower (if using). Grind to a fine powder. Set aside.
Step 2: Prepare the Rice: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in enough water for 20 to 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Step 3: Prepare the Aromatics and Paneer: Thinly slice the onion. Chop the mint leaves. Crush the ginger, garlic, and green chili into a paste using a mortar and pestle. Cut the paneer into cubes.

Step 4: Sauté the Onions and Spices: Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee or oil in a large pot or pan over medium heat. Add the bay leaf and sauté for a few seconds. Add the sliced onions and sauté until golden brown or caramelized.

Step 5: Add Ginger-Garlic Paste and Spices: Add the ginger-garlic-chili paste and sauté until the raw aroma dissipates (about 10-15 seconds). Stir in the chopped mint leaves and the ground pulao masala. Sauté for 5-8 seconds.
Step 6: Add Peas (Optional) and Rice: If using peas (or other vegetables), add them to the pot and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Add the drained rice and stir gently. Sauté for 1 minute.

Step 7: Cook the Rice: Add 3 to 3 1/4 cups of water, lemon juice (if using), and salt to the pot. Stir well. Cover the pot tightly with a lid and simmer over low to medium heat until the rice is cooked through and the water is absorbed. Add more water if needed.

Step 8: Pan-Fry the Paneer: While the rice is cooking, heat 2-3 teaspoons of ghee or oil in a separate non-stick pan or tawa over medium heat. Add the paneer cubes and pan-fry until light golden brown. Do not overfry. Set aside.

Step 9: Combine Paneer and Rice: Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat and let it rest for 5 minutes. Gently mix in the pan-fried paneer cubes. Cover the pot again and let it sit for another 5 minutes to allow the paneer to absorb the flavors of the pulao.
Step 10: Serve: Serve the paneer pulao hot or warm, garnished with fresh mint leaves and additional pan-fried paneer cubes. Raita, dal fry, or dal tadka are excellent accompaniments.

recipes.name: Tandoori Paneer Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
1 green bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
directions: Step 1: Soak 8-10 wooden skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
Step 2: In a food processor, combine the minced garlic and ginger and process until a smooth paste forms.

Step 3: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, mustard oil, juice of 1/2 lime, 1 1/2 teaspoons fenugreek leaves, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, and half of the ginger-garlic paste. Add the paneer, bell peppers, and 1/2 large onion. Stir until all ingredients are well coated.
Step 4: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Step 5: Thread the marinated paneer, bell peppers, and onion onto the soaked skewers.
Step 6: Place the skewers in a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown.
Step 7: While the kebabs are baking, soak the cashews in hot water for 10 minutes. Then, drain and blend until smooth.

Step 8: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the cumin seeds and cook until they sputter, about 1 minute. Add the finely chopped onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.  Add the remaining ginger-garlic paste, 1 tablespoon fenugreek leaves, and 1/2 teaspoon garam masala. Cook and stir for about 2 minutes, until fragrant.
Step 9: Add the chopped tomatoes to the saucepan, cover, and cook until they break down, about 5 minutes.

Step 10: Stir in the blended cashews, juice of 1/2 lime, ground coriander, 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, turmeric, and salt. Simmer until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes. Add a little water if the sauce becomes too thick.
Step 11: Add the baked paneer kebabs to the sauce and stir to coat evenly. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Paneer 65 (Spicy Fried Indian Cheese)
ingredients: ½ teaspoon Red chili powder (or Kashmiri red chili powder)
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the rice flour, besan, and corn starch.
Step 2: Add the green chili paste, garlic paste, ginger paste, red chili powder, garam masala powder, lime juice, and salt. Mix well.
Step 3: Add water and whisk until a smooth paste forms.
Step 4: Add the paneer cubes to the batter and gently mix to coat. Cover and marinate for 15-20 minutes at room temperature.
Step 5: Heat 5 tablespoons of oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry the coated paneer cubes in batches, ensuring they don't stick together, until golden brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels.
Step 6: In the same pan, heat 2 teaspoons of oil. Add mustard seeds (if using) and let them crackle.
Step 7: Add chopped ginger, garlic, green chilies, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté briefly.
Step 8: Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Step 9: Add salt and sugar (if using). Stir well.
Step 10: Add the fried paneer cubes to the pan and toss with the sautéed ingredients.
Step 11: Check the taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Remove from heat.
Step 12: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipes.name: Paneer Stuffed Kulcha
ingredients: ½ teaspoon ajwain (carom seeds) or cumin seeds
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking soda, yogurt, oil/ghee, sugar, and salt.

Step 2: Gradually add ¼ cup of water and mix with a spoon or your hands. Continue adding water in small increments, kneading until a smooth and soft dough forms. The amount of water needed may vary depending on the flour quality.
Step 3: Cover the dough and let it rest for 2 hours to allow it to rise.

Step 4: While the dough rests, prepare the paneer filling. Crumble or grate the paneer and combine it with chopped coriander leaves, green chilies, red chili powder, garam masala, ajwain/cumin seeds, dry mango powder, and salt.
Step 5: Mix the filling ingredients thoroughly and adjust seasonings as needed. Cover and set aside.
Step 6: After 2 hours, lightly knead the dough again. Divide the dough into medium-sized balls. Optionally, cover and let the dough balls rest for 15-20 minutes.
Step 7: Dust a dough ball with flour and roll it into a 5-6 inch diameter circle.
Step 8: Place 2-3 tablespoons of the paneer filling in the center of the rolled dough, leaving a 1-1.5 inch border.
Step 9: Bring the edges of the dough together to enclose the filling, pinching them firmly to seal.
Step 10: Sprinkle sesame seeds on top (optional) and lightly press them into the dough.
Step 11: Gently roll the stuffed kulcha into a larger disc, about 6-7 inches in diameter.
Step 12: Heat a tava or griddle over medium heat. Place the kulcha on the hot surface.
Step 13: Cook for a few minutes until partly cooked, then flip. Spread ghee or oil on the cooked side.
Step 14: Flip again and spread ghee or oil on the other side. Press the edges with a spatula to ensure they are cooked through.
Step 15: Flip once or twice more, cooking until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from the tava and spread with butter.
Step 16: Repeat steps 7-15 with the remaining dough balls.
Step 17: Serve the paneer kulchas hot or warm with butter, yogurt, mango pickle, or your favorite curry.

recipes.name: Matar Paneer (Indian Cheese and Peas Curry)
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder or 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder or cayenne pepper
1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder or Punjabi garam masala powder
1 tablespoon light or heavy cream or malai (optional)
1 cup green peas (fresh or frozen), approximately 130 grams
1 to 1 1/4 cups water (for stove-top pressure cooker) or 1 cup water (for Instant Pot)
250 to 300 grams paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed
1/2 teaspoon crushed kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves)
1 to 2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves (cilantro)
3/4 to 1 cup chopped tomatoes (approximately 120 grams or 3 medium)
1/2 cup chopped onions (approximately 60 grams or 1 medium)
1 teaspoon chopped green chilies or serrano peppers (1 to 2 green chilies)
1 teaspoon chopped garlic (3 to 4 medium cloves)
1 inch true cinnamon or 1/2 inch cassia cinnamon
directions: 1. Prepare the Masala Paste: Combine onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, cashews, coriander leaves, black peppercorns, cinnamon, cardamom (if using), coriander seeds, and cloves in a grinder or blender.
2. Grind to a smooth paste. Add 2 to 3 tablespoons of water if needed to facilitate blending. Ensure there are no cashew chunks remaining.
3. Sauté the Paste: Heat oil or ghee in a 2-liter pressure cooker or a heavy pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.

4. Add the ground masala paste and sauté for 10-12 minutes over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until the oil separates and the paste thickens and becomes glossy. If using an Instant Pot, use the sauté function.
5. Add Spices: Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala powder. If using cream or malai, add it at this stage and sauté for another minute.
6. Add Peas and Water: Add green peas, water, and salt. Mix well.
7. Pressure Cook (Stovetop): Cover the cooker tightly and pressure cook for 2-3 whistles or 9-10 minutes. Allow the pressure to release naturally.
8. Pressure Cook (Instant Pot): Seal the lid and set the valve to "Sealing." Pressure cook on high for 3 minutes, then allow a 5-minute natural pressure release followed by a quick release.
9. Simmer (Pan): Cover the pan and cook until the peas are tender. Add more water if the curry becomes too thick.
10. Adjust Consistency: Once the pressure is released (or peas are cooked), check the curry's consistency. Simmer and reduce if too thin, or add water if too thick.
11. Add Paneer: Gently add the paneer cubes. Simmer briefly until heated through. Do not overcook.
12. Final Touches: Add sugar (optional) and crushed kasuri methi (if using). Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
13. Serve: Serve hot with roti, paratha, naan, rice, or puri.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Cutlets
ingredients: ¾ cup green peas (fresh or frozen)
½ teaspoon red chili powder (or cayenne pepper)
3-4 tablespoons rice flour (or cornstarch, arrowroot flour, or roasted gram flour)
3 tablespoons semolina (or breadcrumbs, crushed oats, or crushed corn flakes)
directions: Step 1: Pressure cook the vegetables: In a pressure cooker, combine the potatoes, carrot, green peas, and water. Cook for 3-4 whistles over medium-high heat. Allow the pressure to release naturally before opening the lid. Alternatively, boil the vegetables in a pan or Instant Pot with sufficient water until tender.
Step 2: Prepare the spice paste: While the vegetables are cooking, combine the green chili, garlic, and ginger in a mortar and pestle. Grind to a semi-fine paste.
Step 3: Mash the vegetables: Once the vegetables have cooled, mash them thoroughly in a mixing bowl.

Step 4: Combine the ingredients: Add the spice paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, grated paneer, rice flour, salt, and chopped coriander leaves to the mashed vegetables. Mix well and adjust salt to taste.
Step 5: Shape the cutlets: Take a portion of the mixture and shape it into a cutlet or patty.
Step 6: Coat the cutlets: Spread the semolina on a plate. Coat each cutlet evenly with semolina, dusting off any excess.
Step 7: Fry the cutlets: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry the cutlets in batches until golden brown and crisp on both sides. Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Step 8: Serve: Serve the paneer cutlets hot with your favorite chutney, sauce, or dip.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy golden-brown paneer cutlets, stacked slightly overlapping, on a rustic wooden board.  A small bowl of vibrant green chutney sits alongside.  Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the cutlets' texture and the warm, inviting tones. Shallow depth of field, focusing on the front cutlet, with a blurred background of textured linen. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh coriander and a few scattered green peas. Aim for a rustic, comforting mood.

recipes.name: Paneer Khurchan (Scrambled Indian Cheese)
ingredients: 250 grams paneer, cut into 1.5 to 2-inch batons
½-¾ teaspoon red chili powder (or cayenne pepper)
½ teaspoon kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves), crushed
2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Paneer: Cut the paneer into batons or strips about 1.5 to 2 inches long.
Step 2: Prepare the Vegetables: Thinly slice the onions, chop the tomatoes, and dice the bell pepper. Slit the green chilies and julienne the ginger. Reserve a few ginger juliennes for garnish.
Step 3: Sauté the Vegetables: Heat oil in a large iron tawa (or a thick-bottomed iron or steel kadai) over medium-low heat. Add the sliced onions and sauté until translucent, stirring often.

Step 4: Add Tomatoes and Peppers: Add the chopped tomatoes and diced bell pepper to the pan. Continue sautéing and stirring for 7-8 minutes, or until the tomatoes soften and the bell pepper is slightly cooked.
Step 5: Add Spices: Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, asafoetida, and salt. Stir well to combine with the vegetables.
Step 6: Add Chilies and Ginger: Add the slit green chilies and julienned ginger to the pan. Stir and mix.
Step 7: Add Paneer: Add the paneer strips to the pan and stir well to coat with the spice mixture. Increase the heat to high.

Step 8: Sear the Paneer: Arrange the paneer strips so that they are in contact with the tawa, allowing them to brown slightly. Cook for about a minute, then scrape the paneer from the bottom of the pan. Reduce heat if browning too quickly.
Step 9: Flip and Brown: Flip the paneer strips and brown the other side. Continue scraping and stirring to prevent sticking.

Step 10: Finish and Garnish: Once the paneer is lightly browned, turn off the heat. Add the cream (if using) and crushed kasuri methi. Stir well to combine. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and reserved ginger juliennes.
Step 11: Serve: Serve the paneer khurchan hot or warm, optionally with a squeeze of lime juice, alongside chapatis, rotis, naan, or paratha.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Patties
ingredients: 4-5 tablespoons Oil or Ghee, for frying
directions: Step 1: Rinse the potatoes thoroughly and boil them with salt in a pressure cooker or Instant Pot until tender.
Step 2: Once the pressure releases naturally, open the lid and check the potatoes with a fork. If cooked through, let them cool slightly, then peel and mash them in a bowl.
Step 3: Add the crumbled or grated paneer, ground black pepper, cornflour, and salt to the mashed potatoes.
Step 4: Mix everything well until smooth and even. Add a little more cornflour if the mixture is too loose.
Step 5: Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Step 6: Divide the mixture into equal portions, shape them into balls, and flatten them into patties.
Step 7: Heat oil or ghee in a well-seasoned skillet over medium-low to medium heat.
Step 8: Fry the patties in batches until golden brown and crisp on both sides, turning as needed.
Step 9: Remove the patties from the skillet and place them on absorbent paper towels to drain excess oil.
Step 10: Serve hot with your favorite chutney or ketchup.

recipes.name: Kadai Paneer
ingredients: 5-6 Kashmiri red chilies, broken and deseeded
4 tablespoons oil or butter or ghee
1.5-2 inches ginger, crushed to a paste
7-8 cloves garlic, crushed to a paste
7 medium tomatoes, 2 finely chopped and 5 pureed
1 medium green bell pepper (capsicum), thinly sliced
1 teaspoon kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves), crushed
2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves (cilantro) for garnish
2 tablespoons light cream or 1 tablespoon heavy cream (optional)
directions: Step 1: Dry roast coriander seeds and Kashmiri red chilies in a pan over low heat until fragrant. Let cool and grind into a semi-fine powder. Set aside.
Step 2: Heat oil/butter/ghee in a kadai or large pan. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until fragrant.
Step 3: Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Step 4: Add the ground spice powder and green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Step 5: Add finely chopped tomatoes and sauté until pulpy and oil starts to separate.
Step 6: Add tomato puree and sauté for 9-10 minutes over low heat, until oil separates.
Step 7: Add sliced bell pepper and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Step 8: Add water and salt. Simmer for 7-8 minutes.
Step 9: Add crushed kasuri methi and garam masala powder. Stir well.
Step 10: Gently add paneer cubes and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Step 11: (Optional) Stir in cream.
Step 12: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

Use warm, diffused lighting to create a cozy, inviting mood.  Garnish with fresh coriander sprigs and a swirl of cream.  A dark, textured background will enhance the dish's colors.

recipes.name: Creamy Paneer Kheer
ingredients: 1/2 cup crumbled or grated paneer (about 50 grams)
1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom (or 3-4 green cardamom pods)
1-1.5 teaspoons rose water or 1 drop rose essence (optional)
directions: Step 1: In a heavy-bottomed saucepan or pot, heat the milk over medium-low heat. Stir occasionally to prevent scorching.
Step 2: While the milk heats, crumble or grate the paneer.
Step 3: If using cardamom pods, finely grind them in a mortar and pestle. Chop the nuts.
Step 4: Once the milk comes to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened.
Step 5: Add the sugar and continue simmering for another 5 minutes, stirring to dissolve.
Step 6: Add the chopped almonds, pistachios, cashews, ground cardamom, and saffron (if using). Stir well and simmer for 1-2 minutes.

Step 7: Add the crumbled or grated paneer. If using refrigerated or frozen paneer, you may want to soak it in warm water briefly before adding. Simmer for 1 minute, or until the paneer is heated through.
Step 8: Stir in the rose water or rose essence (if using).
Step 9: Serve the paneer kheer hot, warm, or chilled.

recipes.name: Matar Paneer (Indian Peas with Paneer Cheese)
ingredients: 2 cups paneer cheese, cut into cubes
directions: Step 1: Heat 1-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or ghee in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté the paneer cubes in batches until lightly browned on all sides. Remove paneer from skillet and drain on paper towels. Set aside.

Step 2: In the same skillet, heat the remaining 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil or ghee over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, minced ginger, and minced garlic. Cook until the onion is softened and translucent, about 3-5 minutes.
Step 3: Add the ground coriander, ground cumin, salt, turmeric, and cayenne pepper to the skillet. Cook until the spices become fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Step 4: Add the diced tomatoes (with juice) to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Step 5: Return the browned paneer to the skillet. Add the water and thawed green peas. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 6: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the peas are cooked through.
Step 7: Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Pakoda with Tangy Chaat Masala Chutney
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Brown Rice Flour (or Rice Flour)
115 grams Paneer, cut into bite-sized cubes
Salt and freshly ground Black Pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: Heat enough oil for deep frying in a large pot or deep fryer over medium-high heat.
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the chickpea flour, brown rice flour, fenugreek leaves, garam masala, Kashmiri chili powder, salt, pepper, and baking soda (if using).
Step 3: Gradually add water to the dry ingredients, mixing until a thick batter forms. The batter should be thick enough to coat the paneer but still flowy.
Step 4: Add the paneer cubes to the batter and ensure they are well coated.
Step 5: Carefully drop a few battered paneer cubes at a time into the hot oil. Avoid overcrowding the pot.
Step 6: Fry the pakoda for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Step 7: Remove the pakoda from the oil and drain on paper towels to absorb excess oil.
Step 8: To prepare the chutney, combine the ketchup, water, chaat masala, sugar, and sea salt in a small bowl. Mix well and adjust seasoning as needed.
Step 9: Serve the hot, crispy paneer pakoda with the tangy chaat masala chutney.

Use a shallow depth of field to focus on the pakoda closest to the camera, showcasing its texture. Backlight the scene to enhance the crispiness and create a warm, inviting mood. Garnish with a sprinkle of chaat masala and fresh cilantro. Incorporate a dark, textured background to make the pakoda pop. recipes.name: Creamy Palak Paneer (Indian Spinach and Cheese)
ingredients: 1/3 cup finely chopped onion (1 small-medium onion)
1 teaspoon finely chopped garlic (4-5 small cloves)
1/3 cup finely chopped tomato (1 small-medium tomato)
200-250 grams paneer (Indian cottage cheese) or firm tofu, cubed
2 tablespoons low-fat cream or 1 tablespoon heavy cream
1 teaspoon dried fenugreek leaves (kasuri methi), crushed (optional)
directions: Step 1: Rinse the spinach thoroughly under running water. Discard stringy stems.
Step 2: Boil 3 cups of water. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add spinach to boiling water and blanch for 1 minute.
Step 3: Transfer spinach to an ice bath (3 cups water with ice cubes) for 1 minute to retain its vibrant color. Drain well.
Step 4: Blend spinach, chopped ginger, garlic, and green chilies into a smooth puree.
Step 5: Heat oil/ghee/butter in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Step 6: Add the bay leaf and sauté for a few seconds.
Step 7: Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Step 8: Add chopped garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Step 9: Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until softened.
Step 10: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and asafoetida (if using). Mix well.
Step 11: Add the spinach puree and 1/2 cup water (or as needed). Mix well.
Step 12: Simmer for 6-7 minutes, or until spinach is cooked and the sauce thickens. Season with salt.
Step 13: Add garam masala powder and mix well.
Step 14: Gently add paneer/tofu cubes. Stir briefly, avoiding overcooking.
Step 15: Stir in cream and remove from heat.
Step 16: Garnish with cream/butter, ginger juliennes, and lemon/lime wedges (optional). Serve hot with roti, naan, rice, or other Indian breads.

A dark, textured backdrop and a few scattered spinach leaves will complete the rustic, inviting mood. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle to showcase the dish's consistency and garnish.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer (Indian Spinach with Paneer Cheese)
directions: Step 1: Wash and chop the spinach. In a pot, cook the spinach with 3 tablespoons of water until tender. Remove from heat and set aside.
Step 2: Heat ghee or oil in a large pan or pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Step 3: Add ground cinnamon, cardamom, and ginger to the pan and sauté for another minute until fragrant.
Step 4: Add minced garlic and chopped tomatoes to the pan. Reduce heat to low and cook until the tomatoes soften.
Step 5: Gradually whisk in the plain yogurt, a little at a time, to prevent curdling. Cook for a few minutes until the yogurt is heated through.
Step 6: Add coriander powder, garam masala, paprika, and salt to the pan. Mix well and cook for a minute.
Step 7: Add the cooked spinach (along with any remaining liquid) to the pan. Cover and simmer on low heat for 20-30 minutes.
Step 8: Remove the pan from heat. Take half of the spinach mixture and puree it in a food processor or blender until smooth. Return the pureed spinach to the pan and stir to combine.
Step 9: Gently stir in the heavy cream and heat through on low heat. Do not boil.
Step 10: Add the cubed paneer cheese to the pan and stir gently to coat. Heat through until the paneer is warmed.
Step 11: Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Bread Rolls
ingredients: 8-10 slices whole wheat bread (brown bread can also be used)
1 tablespoon coriander leaves, chopped (parsley leaves can be substituted)
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (cayenne pepper can be substituted)
1/2 teaspoon chaat masala powder (or 1/2 teaspoon dry mango powder/amchur)
Oil or softened butter, for brushing
directions: Step 1: Crumble the paneer. If using fresh paneer, it crumbles easily. If using cold or frozen paneer, soak it in warm water for a few minutes, drain well, and pat dry with paper towels before crumbling.
Step 2: In a bowl, combine the crumbled paneer, minced ginger, chopped green chili, and chopped coriander leaves.
Step 3: Add the red chili powder, ground coriander, garam masala, chaat masala (or amchur powder), and salt. Mix thoroughly.
Step 4: Trim the crusts from each bread slice and lightly flatten with a rolling pin. (Save the crusts to make breadcrumbs later.)
Step 5: Place 2 tablespoons of the paneer mixture on one side of a bread slice.
Step 6: Brush the edges of the bread slice with water.
Step 7: Fold the bread slice over the filling to form a rectangular roll, pressing the edges to seal.
Step 8: Place the prepared rolls on a baking tray.
Step 9: Lightly brush the rolls with oil or softened butter.
Step 10: Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (390°F) for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown and crisp. Keep an eye on them as oven temperatures may vary.
Step 11: Serve the paneer bread rolls hot or warm with tomato ketchup, coriander chutney, or tamarind chutney.

recipes.name: Tawa Paneer
ingredients: 1 medium Green Bell Pepper (Capsicum), finely chopped
½ teaspoon Kashmiri Red Chili Powder (or Paprika/Cayenne Pepper)
1 teaspoon Pav Bhaji Masala (or ½ teaspoon Garam Masala + ½ teaspoon Amchur Powder)
½ teaspoon Kasuri Methi (dried Fenugreek Leaves), crushed
directions: Step 1: Finely chop the onion and green bell pepper.
Step 2: Roughly chop the tomatoes, green chili, ginger, and garlic.
Step 3: Mince the ginger and garlic together into a paste.
Step 4: Purée the chopped tomatoes in a blender until smooth. Set aside.
Step 5: Cut the paneer into small cubes.
Step 6: Melt the butter in a tawa (or frying pan/skillet).
Step 7: Add the carom seeds and fry for a few seconds until aromatic.
Step 8: Add the chopped onions and sauté, stirring frequently, until softened and translucent.
Step 9: Add the ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chilies to the pan. Sauté for about 3 minutes over low to medium-low heat.
Step 10: Add the chopped green bell pepper and sauté for another 3 minutes.
Step 11: Add the red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and pav bhaji masala (or garam masala and amchur powder). Stir and sauté for about 1 minute.
Step 12: Add the tomato purée and salt. Stir well.
Step 13: Sauté until the butter begins to separate from the masala and the mixture thickens slightly (about 8-10 minutes over low heat). Add 1-2 tablespoons of water if needed.
Step 14: Gently add the paneer cubes and mix until evenly coated with the masala. Turn off the heat.
Step 15: Add the crushed kasuri methi and mix gently.
Step 16: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti, naan, paratha, or bread, accompanied by lemon wedges and a side of onion salad (optional).

Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs and a sprinkle of carom seeds. cooking_tips: For a spicier dish, add more green chilies or red chili powder.
Adjust the amount of pav bhaji masala or garam masala and amchur powder to your liking.
If you don't have kasuri methi, you can omit it or substitute with a pinch of dried oregano.

recipes.name: Paneer Bhurji (Scrambled Indian Cheese)
ingredients: 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste (or 3-4 small garlic cloves + 1 inch ginger, crushed)
1-2 green chilies, finely chopped or slit
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (or 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper)
directions: Step 1: Crumble the paneer and set aside.
Step 2: Finely chop the onions, tomatoes, and green chilies. Set aside.
Step 3: Heat the oil in a pan over medium-low to medium heat.
Step 4: Add the cumin seeds and let them crackle until fragrant and lightly browned.
Step 5: Add the chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Step 6: Add the ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a few seconds until the raw aroma disappears.
Step 7: Add the chopped tomatoes and a pinch of salt. Sauté until softened.
Step 8: Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix well and sauté for 5-6 seconds.
Step 9: Add the crumbled paneer and mix thoroughly. Cook for 1 minute, or until heated through. Do not overcook.
Step 10: Stir in the chopped coriander leaves.
Step 11: Serve hot with roti, paratha, toast, or as a filling for burritos or wraps.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Paneer Bhurji, its vibrant yellow-orange hue emphasized by soft, directional light.  The crumbled texture should be clearly visible, with a shallow depth of field focusing on a forkful lifted from the pan.  Use a dark, rustic background and minimal props, perhaps a scattering of cumin seeds and a sprig of cilantro for garnish. The mood should be warm and inviting, evoking the comforting aroma of the spices.

video_script.title: Paneer Bhurji: Easy Scrambled Indian Cheese
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious and flavorful Paneer Bhurji, a popular North Indian breakfast dish, in under 15 minutes!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of golden-brown, crumbly paneer bhurji, garnished with fresh coriander leaves.  A side of roti is slightly blurred in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a quick and protein-packed breakfast or snack? Look no further than Paneer Bhurji – a simple yet incredibly flavorful scrambled Indian cheese dish. Let's get started!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table. Grouped ingredients: oil/ghee, spices, paneer, vegetables, herbs.
scenes.voice_over: Here’s what you’ll need: oil or ghee, cumin seeds, onion, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, paneer, salt, and fresh coriander leaves.

scenes.image_prompt: Crumbling paneer into a bowl with fingers.
scenes.voice_over: First, crumble the paneer. This ensures even cooking and a pleasant texture.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopping onions, tomatoes, and chilies on a cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Finely chop your onions, tomatoes, and green chilies. Set everything aside for a smooth cooking process.

scenes.image_prompt: Oil heating in a pan with cumin seeds added, starting to sizzle.
scenes.voice_over: Heat about 3 tablespoons of oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter – this releases their amazing aroma.

scenes.image_prompt: Onions cooking in the pan with cumin seeds, becoming translucent.
scenes.voice_over: Add the chopped onions and sauté until translucent.  This usually takes about 3-4 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Ginger-garlic paste and green chilies added to the pan with onions, being stirred and cooked.
scenes.voice_over: Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a few seconds until fragrant.

scenes.image_prompt: Tomatoes being added to the spice mixture, cooking down and softening.
scenes.voice_over: Add the chopped tomatoes and a pinch of salt.  Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.  This creates a nice base for our dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Dry spices being added to the pan with the tomato mixture, stirring to combine.
scenes.voice_over: Now for the spices! Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.  Mix well and cook for about 5-6 seconds.

scenes.image_prompt: Crumbled paneer added to the pan, mixing gently with the spices.
scenes.voice_over: Gently fold in the crumbled paneer and mix everything together. Cook for just a minute until heated through.  Avoid overcooking, as this can make the paneer tough.

scenes.image_prompt: Close up shot of finished paneer bhurji garnished with coriander, served with roti and a side salad.
scenes.voice_over: Finally, stir in the chopped coriander leaves for a fresh, vibrant finish. Serve your delicious Paneer Bhurji hot with roti, paratha, or even toast. It also makes a great burrito filling!

cooking_tips: Do not overcook the paneer, as it can become dry and hard.
Adjust the amount of chili powder to your preference.
For a richer flavor, use ghee or butter instead of oil.

recipes.name: Paneer Makhanwala (Butter Paneer)
ingredients: 1 inch Ginger, chopped (or 1 teaspoon chopped ginger)
3-4 cloves Garlic, chopped (or ½ teaspoon chopped garlic)
1-1.5 teaspoons Kashmiri Red Chili Powder (or Deghi Mirch or Sweet Paprika)
¼ cup Light Cream or Low-Fat Cooking Cream
½ teaspoon Kasuri Methi (dried fenugreek leaves), crushed
1 tablespoon Light Cream or Cooking Cream
directions: Step 1: Combine the chopped onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, cashews, mace, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamoms with 1 cup of water in a medium saucepan.
Step 2: Cook uncovered over medium heat for 14-15 minutes, or until the tomatoes and onions soften. Allow the mixture to cool.
Step 3: Transfer the cooled mixture, including the cooking water, to a blender or grinder. Blend until smooth and fine, ensuring no small pieces of cashews or spices remain.
Step 4: Heat the softened butter in a dry pan (either the same saucepan or a new one). Add the tej patta and sauté for a few seconds.
Step 5: Add the blended makhani paste to the pan and stir well to combine with the butter.
Step 6: Add the Kashmiri red chili powder (or deghi mirch or sweet paprika) and stir well.

Step 7: Sauté the masala over medium heat, stirring frequently, for 20-22 minutes, or until the butter begins to separate from the sides. This step requires patience, as proper sautéing is crucial for developing the flavor.
Step 8: Add the slit green chili, salt, and 1.5 cups of water. Stir well to create a smooth curry mixture and cook for 4-5 minutes.
Step 9: Add the sugar (or honey, see notes) and stir well.
Step 10: Gently add the paneer cubes and mix. Turn off the heat.
Step 11: Stir in the light cream, crushed kasuri methi, and garam masala.

Step 12: Check the taste and adjust salt or sugar as needed. Serve hot or warm, garnished with cream, grated paneer (optional), julienned ginger, and chopped coriander leaves.  Serve with naan or roti.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Paneer Makhanwala in a rustic, earthenware bowl, nestled against a dark, textured backdrop. Soft, directional light should highlight the creamy texture and rich orange hue of the sauce, glistening with butter.  Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped cilantro and a swirl of cream. Shallow depth of field, focusing on a piece of paneer, with blurred background elements creating a warm, inviting mood.  Include a few cashews and a touch of spice blend visibly around the bowl for context.

video_script.title: Paneer Makhanwala (Butter Paneer) - Restaurant Style
video_script.description: Learn how to make creamy and delicious Paneer Makhanwala at home with this easy-to-follow recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished Paneer Makhanwala dish, garnished with cream, grated paneer, julienned ginger, and coriander leaves. The dish is served with naan bread.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making Paneer Makhanwala, a rich and flavorful Indian curry. It's creamy, buttery, and incredibly delicious!

scenes.image_prompt: Grouped ingredients: Chopped onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, whole cashews. Text overlay: Aromatics and Base
scenes.voice_over: Let's start with the aromatics. We'll need onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and some cashews for richness.

scenes.image_prompt: Spices grouped together: Mace, green cardamoms, cinnamon stick, cloves, Kashmiri red chili powder, tej patta (Indian bay leaf), Kasuri Methi, Garam Masala. Text overlay: Spices
scenes.voice_over: For the signature flavor, we'll use mace, green cardamoms, cinnamon, cloves, Kashmiri red chili powder, bay leaf, Kasuri Methi, and Garam Masala.

scenes.image_prompt: The onion-tomato mixture simmering in a saucepan with water, spices, and cashews.
scenes.voice_over: Combine the chopped onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, cashews, and spices with 1 cup of water. Cook uncovered over medium heat for 14-15 minutes until softened.

scenes.image_prompt: The simmered mixture being blended in a blender until smooth.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooled, blend the mixture until completely smooth. Ensure no cashew or spice pieces remain.

scenes.image_prompt: Butter melting in a pan with a bay leaf.
scenes.voice_over: In a pan, melt the butter and sauté a bay leaf for a few seconds.

scenes.image_prompt: The blended makhani paste being added to the pan with butter and sautéed.
scenes.voice_over: Add the blended paste to the pan and sauté for 20-22 minutes over medium heat until the butter separates.

scenes.image_prompt: Paneer cubes being added to the simmering curry.
scenes.voice_over: Add the green chili, salt, water, and sugar. Simmer for 4-5 minutes. Gently add the paneer cubes. Turn off the heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Cream, Kasuri Methi, and Garam Masala being stirred into the curry.
scenes.voice_over: Stir in the cream, Kasuri Methi, and Garam Masala.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished Paneer Makhanwala, garnished and served with naan bread.
scenes.voice_over: Garnish with cream, grated paneer, ginger, and coriander. Serve hot with naan or roti. Enjoy your delicious Paneer Makhanwala!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, roast the cashews before grinding.
Adjust the amount of chili powder to control the spice level.
If using honey instead of sugar, add it along with the cream in the final step.
Soaking the cashews in hot water for 30 minutes before blending can create an extra creamy sauce.
